reviews.review_msg: David is a super engaging prof. He is very inspirational/dedicated to what he does. Very helpful outside class aswell. HOWEVER, I dont know why he has such a low rating for easiness, he is an extremely hard marker with super hard essay topics. I worked harder for a B in his class then any other class (3.7 GPA). Has a vision you must see to do well

David is an incredible prof! We had five books to read in one term - by no means an easy task - and two papers to write. I'll admit that the readings were much harder than I'd expected for a first-year class, but despite that, and the fact that I had a night class, David was engaging and kept us all awake. He's a tough marker but you learn so much!
Amazing prof, great lecturer, funny and engaging. One of the best profs I've had at SFU.

Wow, the best prof ever. Marks you based on your ideas, not for grammar, punctuation, or things like that. HIGHLY recommend because he's so funny :) If you're looking for a do-able English class, must have David Coley as a prof!

Tiffany is extremely well spoken, always prepared for lectures and very interesting to listen to. The course had to much reading material (in my opinion) and lecture slides were not posted online. Would definitely recommend this class to anyone in need of a English course.
english is pretty boring, but she always kept the debate going. pretty quirky lady. great TAs for this class, piece of cake, b+ and i did maybe 1/4 of the reading :)

His Intro to Issues in Lit and Culture course was amazing. He wasn't funny, and my friend thought he was a dirty old man, but it's really interesting stuff! Many people don't understand him, but he makes perfect sense to me. His exams and assignments are jokishly easy, and the TA's are laid back. It's a good intro course to help adjust to univ.
funny guy...good prof...hated pop quizes almost impossible to study...unorganized but overall good class
Rick was a lot better last year than this year.  Don't know why but he's lost his game.  It's a shame too, lectures were a waste of time and disorganized and not entirely interesting.

She is okay prof. the usual. She is nice and always willing to help her students you just need to ask for it. Lectures were boring. Marks came from 1 midterm, 1 essay, journal, tutorial, and final. So well- balanced.
OK she is hot! And such an awesome prof! super helpful. lets you know what she wants! would definitely take an another class with her. recommended!

Let me just start by saying that I'm an Eng/Humanities lover so I may be a little biased but I SPECIALLY came on this website to write her a review - she is ABSOLUTELY fantastic, so very knowledgeable and I am so glad that I got to learn from someone like her. Take her class, one of the best ones ever at SFU.
Solid Prof. Would take another class with him. Teaches content very well and welcomes debate and discussion. Encourages creativity
Chooses interesting course material. Lectures are straight forward but sometimes go off into tangents. Exam is super easy if you attend all the lectures and do all your readings.
Mr. Rogers impersonator!!!!

Absolutely AMAZING lectures. I was always engrossed in what he had to say. Super nice and thoughtful guy and the only prof that made me want to participate in class discussions. Grading depends solely on TAs. A good grade was fairly easy to obtain just read the books and don't depend on the lectures insights only. Average was B.
Such a funny prof. Really clear about what needs to be known and super good lecture presentations as well. He prepared students well for the final exam.
im taking english105W right now, he's an awesome professor...he helps you as long as you go to his class and arrange a time with him...Best english prof ever

One of the very first profs I've ever had at sfu.  He is very interesting and funny, makes the class a great and memorable class, definitely wasn't boring at all.  He chose somewhat interesting books for the course. I had him for my TA as well, and his marking was fair.  The exam overall was fair too.

If you have the choice of taking and English class with Mr. Budra... do it! Ridiculously funny, keeps class interesting, and just a great guy in general .... TA's are great as well. Scott Marsden was my TA and he was the most supportive and helpful TA ever!
Great prof, actually was able to keep an English class interesting. I would recommend  taking any class he teaches.
The best T.A I have had in my University life. Always there for help regardless if current TA or not. Very dependable. If ever taking an English class, make sure you have Scott Marsden as your TA.

Issues in Literature and Culture: study of Frankenstein. Wonderful course! Took it in my first semester at SFU. This class sealed the deal for my degree choice. Linley is a wonderful prof that is incredibly passionate about her material. Needless to mention, teaching first year courses are a bit of a challenge for profs- but she pulls it off well.
